wikipedia_page.main: Vice Admiral Sir Peter Spencer KCB (born 1947) is a Royal Navy officer who became Second Sea Lord.

link_mentions.page: Second Sea Lord and Deputy Chief of Naval Staff

response: The programme was widely judged to be "a profoundly inept piece of procurement": Sir Peter Spencer, who as head of Defence Procurement inherited the project, said that the "original requirement was ... actually impossible.  I mean, there were 100 essential requirements. I read all of them. One of them said to give protection against any missile coming from any direction." Spencer later commented: "it is always hard to imagine why people think you would be able cost effectively to buy a bespoke requirement for a very small production run."
